title: Ida B Wells on activism - context

content.question: Which of the following best describes a historical context for the excerpt?

choices.label: Jim Crow laws enforced racial segregation in the United States, which caused white people in the South to feel more justified in racial attacks.
The election of 1876 ended Reconstruction but increased legal protections for recently freed African Americans, contributing to anger among white Southerners.
The Supreme Court’s ruling in Plessy v. Ferguson introduced the doctrine of “separate but equal” allowing Black businesses to challenge their white counterparts.
Union Army field orders provided so many southern Black people with land and education that white Southerners felt disinherited.

content.answer: Jim Crow laws enforced racial segregation in the United States, which caused white people in the South to feel more justified in racial attacks.
